page.title: 13Nibley Shop,June 25th 1985
page.content: Mr and Mrs Davey are ready for work at 6:00 am,when the newspapers are delivered. At 6:45 the paperboy and girl call for their round. There are not many customers before 9:30 except for school children and workers. Between 9:30 and 1:00 pm 27 people called,mostly women for groceries. A local farmer bought beer and cigarettes for his haymakers. Mr. Davey has to deliver 100 papers to outlying areas. There are fewer customers in the afternoon so the owners find time to do the paper accounts,check the shelves and put up special offers. They have had an off-licence for one year now. Tuesday is perhaps their quietest day of the week.The owners keep the key which allows tourists to visit the Tyndale Monument, which is 15 minutes walk up the hill, just outside the village.
